meanings.definition: Make a room or container airtight.
meanings.sent1: She airproofed the windows to keep the cold air out.
meanings.sent2: The scientist airproofed the laboratory to conduct the experiment accurately.
meanings.sent3: The chef airproofed the cake to prevent it from drying out.
meanings.sent4: The magician airproofed the box, making it seem like the object disappeared into thin air.
meanings.sent5: The astronaut airproofed the helmet before going into space to ensure oxygen supply.

meanings.definition: To seal or close off to prevent the passage of air.
meanings.sent1: He airproofed the door to keep the noise out of the room.
meanings.sent2: The construction worker airproofed the building to protect it from drafts.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel airproofed its nest with leaves to stay warm in winter.
meanings.sent4: The detective airproofed the crime scene to preserve any evidence left behind.
meanings.sent5: The beekeeper airproofed the hive to maintain the right temperature for the bees.
